docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Pick a recipe from the left menu

I have personally made and/or edited every recipie based on my experiences

docs.title: Classic Eggs Benedict
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 4 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 3 egg yolks
  • 1 tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 cup butter
  • 3 English muffins
  • 3 tbsp butter
  • 1 tsp butter
  • 6 thin slices Canadian-style bacon
  • 4 tsp vinegar
  • 6 eggs
  • some paprika
  • 1 1-quart saucepan
  • 1 10-inch skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In 1-quart saucepan, vigorously stir egg yolks and lemon juice with wire whisk. Add 1/4 cup of the butter. Heat over very low heat, stirring constantly with wire whisk, until butter is melted.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Add remaining 1/4 cup butter. Continue stirring vigorously until butter is melted and sauce is thickened. Keep warm.

Note

Be sure butter melts slowly so eggs have time to cook and thicken sauce without curdling. If the sauce curdles (mixture begins to separate and melted butter starts to appear around the edge of the pan and on top of the sauce), add about 1 tablespoon boiling water and beat vigorously with wire whisk or egg beater until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Split English muffins; toast. Spread each muffin half with some of the 3 tablespoons butter; keep warm.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In 10-inch skillet, melt 1 teaspoon butter over medium heat. Cook thin slices Canadian-style bacon in butter until light brown on both sides; keep warm.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Wipe out skillet to clean; fill with 2 to 3 inches water. Add vinegar to water. Heat to boiling; reduce to simmering. Break cold eggs, one at a time, into custard cup or saucer. Holding dish close to water's surface, carefully slip eggs into water. Cook 4 minutes or until whites and yolks are firm, not runny . Remove with slotted spoon.

Note

water should be gently simmering and not boiling

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Place 1 slice bacon on each muffin half. Top with egg. Spoon warm sauce over eggs. Sprinkle with paprika.

Source
  • https://www.bettycrocker.com/recipes/classic-eggs-benedict/575f1efa-6eae-4722-84b7-4da31b05d0c2

docs.title: Fluffiest Pancakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 35 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 2.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 3 tbsp sugar
  • 2 tsp kosher salt
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 2.5 cup buttermilk
  • 8 tbsp melted butter
  • 2 egg yolks
  • 2 egg whites
  • some chocolate chips
  • some small fruit
  • some butter
  • some maple syrup
  • 1 liquid measuring cup
  • 1 small pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl, add the all-purpose flour, sugar, kosher salt, baking powder, and baking soda and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add the buttermilk, melted butter, and egg yolks and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients and gently fold with a rubber spatula until just combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the egg whites and fold until just combined. Be sure not to overmix. Some lumps are okay.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Let the batter rest for 30 minutes at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add oil to small pan and heat over medium low heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add ⅓ cup (75 g) of batter to the pan.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Cook for 3 minutes, until bubbles start to appear on the surface. If adding any toppings like chocolate chips or small fruit , sprinkle over the pancake. Flip the pancake over and cook for another 2 minutes, until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.

Note

Small fruit includes (but not limited to) blueberries, raspberries, blackberry, etc

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text:
Serve the pancakes with butter and maple syrup.

Source
  • https://tasty.co/recipe/tasty-101-buttermilk-pancakes

docs.title: Guy Fieri Donkey Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 0 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 3.2 tbsp mayonnaise
  • 1 tbsp roasted garlic
  • 0.2 tsp mustard
  • 0.03 tsp Worcestershire
  • 0.05 tsp salt
  • 0.03 tsp pepper
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, roasted garlic, mustard , Worcestershire, salt and pepper and mix until smooth.

Note

Yellow mustard can be substituted with spicy mustard

Source
  • https://www.hotrodsrecipes.com/guys-donkey-sauce-for-burgers/

docs.title: Guy Fieri Spicy Sriracha Mayonnaise
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 60 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 0.5 cup sour cream
  • 1.5 tbsp sriracha
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp honey
  • 4 finely chopped green onions
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, sriracha, lemon juice, honey and finely chopped green onions. Stir until well combined. Add salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Let the sauce sit for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. This will allow all the flavors to meld. You can use it immediately, but the longer you let it sit in the refrigerator, the more flavorful it will be.

Source
  • https://www.hotrodsrecipes.com/spicy-sriracha-mayonnaise/

docs.title: Panda Express Orange Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 0 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 0.25 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 0.5 tsp ginger, minced
  • 1 tbsp garlic, minced
  • 0.25 cup sugar
  • 0.25 cup brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup orange juice
  • 0.25 cup white distilled vinegar
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp water
  • 1 tsp sesame oil
  • 1 heavy bottomed pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Set a heavy bottomed pot over medium - high heat and add the oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red pepper flakes, ginger, minced, and garlic, minced, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the sugar and brown sugar, and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add in the orange juice and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add in the white distilled vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the cornstarch and water together and whisk to combine. Add to the pan and stir.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Top with sesame oil.

Source
  • https://tasty.co/recipe/original-orange-chicken-by-panda-express

docs.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 18 1.25 hours

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 1 cup bread flour
  • 0.75 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp table salt
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 2 tbsp water
  • 1 cup dark brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup white sugar
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 0.5 cup milk chocolate chips
  • 5 oz milk chocolate bar, chopped
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 medium or large saucepan
  • 1 large liquid measuring cup
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium bowl, sift together the bread flour, all-purpose flour, table salt, and baking soda. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
In a medium or large saucepan, add the unsalted butter and melt over medium heat.

Note

The larger the pan you use, the quicker the process will be!

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bring the butter to a boil, stirring frequently. As the water begins to boil out of the butter, the milk solids in the butter will separate, sink to the bottom, and begin to toast and brown. As this begins to happen, make sure to stir constantly so the butter browns evenly. It may become quite foamy, splatter a bit, and be difficult to see, so keep a close eye on it, removing from heat and continuing to stir if it starts to foam over.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the butter has turned a nice nutty brown, remove from the heat and pour into a large liquid measuring cup to stop the cooking. Allow it to cool down for a minute or two, give it a stir, and carefully add water to the butter to bring it back up to 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Set aside to cool to room temperature. To help speed this process up, you can place in the fridge for 10 minutes. You want to make sure the butter is still liquid when you're adding it to the dough later on.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer, add dark brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla, and cooled brown butter from before. Cream together until light and fluffy, 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the egg and egg yolk and beat until incorporated.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the contents from the medium bowl (from step 1), about ⅓ at a time, and beat until just incorporated.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Add in milk chocolate chips and milk chocolate bar, chopped into the dough. Use a rubber spatula to get the flour and splattered dough back into the mix.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Scoop the cookies onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in 3-tablespoon-sized mounds, evenly spaced 3 inches (8 cm) apart from one another. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.

Note

For optimal flavor, refrigerate overnight

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350˚F

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bake in a preheated oven for 12-14 minutes

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text:
Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 3 minutes

Source
  • https://tasty.co/recipe/tasty-101-ultimate-brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookies

docs.title: Dough
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 60 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 0.25 oz yeast
  • 1 cup warm milk
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.33 cup margarine
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 eggs
  • 4 cup flour
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For the rolls, dissolve the yeast in the warm milk in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add sugar, margarine, salt, eggs, and flour, mix well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Knead the dough into a large ball, using your hands dusted lightly with flour.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Put in a bowl, cover and let rise in a warm place about 1 hour or until the dough has doubled in size.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface, until it is approximately 21 inches long by 16 inches wide. It should be approximately 1/4 thick.

Source

docs.title: Filling
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 10 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 2.5 tbsp cinnamon
  • 0.33 cup softened margarine

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To make filling, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon in a bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread the softened margarine over the surface of the dough, then sprinkle the brown sugar and cinnamon evenly over the surface.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Working carefully, from the long edge, roll the dough down to the bottom edge.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cut the dough into 1 3/4 inch slices, and place in a lightly greased baking pan.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Bake for 10 minutes or until light golden brown.

Source

docs.title: Icing
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 0 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 8 tbsp margarine
  • 1.5 cup powdered sugar
  • 0.25 cup cream cheese
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • some chocolate syrup

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beat margarine, powdered sugar, cream cheese, vanilla, and salt well with an electric mixer until fluffy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drizzle chocolate syrup over plate about the size of the cinnamon roll.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Place cinnamon roll on plate and spread icing generously.

Source

docs.title: Loaded Twice Baked Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.58 hours

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 4 large potatoes
  • some olive oil
  • some foil
  • 4 tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.33 cup sour cream
  • 0.33 cup milk
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 0.67 cup cheddar cheese
  • 3 tbsp crumbled bacon
  • 0.33 cup cheddar cheese
  • 3 tbsp crumbled bacon
  • 2 tbsp chives
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Rub large potatoes with a little bit of olive oil and wrap in foil, prick with a fork and place on a lined baking sheet. Place in the oven and bake for 1 hour or until tender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Reduce oven to 350 degrees.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using a knife, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Spoon out the inside of the potatoes into a large mixing bowl, taking care not to break the skin. Leave a thin lining of potato for support. Return the potato skins to the baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In the large mixing bowl, add the unsalted butter, sour cream, milk, salt, garlic powder, pepper, paprika, onion powder, cheddar cheese and crumbled bacon. Mash and mix until combined, but still slightly chunky. Scoop filling into the shells, top each potato with cheddar cheese.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Place in the oven and bake for 25 minutes or until the cheese is melty. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with crumbled bacon and the chives.

Source
  • https://lifemadesimplebakes.com/loaded-twice-baked-potatoes-4/

docs.title: Melt in Your Mouth Chicken
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 45 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
  • some buttermilk
  • 0.5 cup mayonnaise
  • 0.5 cup Greek yogurt
  • 0.5 cup parmesan cheese
  • 1 tsp seasoning salt
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 cup parmesan cheese
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 oven
  • 1 9x13 baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
Cut each boneless, skinless chicken breasts into 3 large chunks or strips. Place chicken breast strips/chunks in a bowl of buttermilk. Let it soak for 20 -30 min or overnight.

Note

Be sure to trim excess fat from chicken breasts

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375 F. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, parmesan cheese, seasoning salt, black pepper, and garlic powder.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place chicken into a 9x13 baking dish and spread the mixture evenly on top of the chicken breasts, and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Bake for about 45 minutes, or until cooked through. You can also finish them off under the broiler for a minute or two to get them extra browned on top.

Source
  • https://cakescottage.com/2019/09/20/melt-in-your-mouth-chicken/#wprm-recipe-container-358729

docs.title: Panda Express Orange Chicken
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 35 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 2 lb chicken
  • 1 tbsp salt
  • 1 tsp white pepper
  • 1 cup cornstarch
  • 3 cup flour
  • 1 egg
  • 1.5 cup water
  • 2 tbsp oil
  • 1 cutting board
  • 1 medium mixing bowl
  • 1 heavy bottom pan
  • 1 paper towel-lined plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: On a cutting board, cut chicken into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium mixing bowl, combine salt, white pepper, cornstarch, and flour. Whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the egg, water, and oil until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Heat oil in a wok or heavy bottom pan to 350˚F (180˚C).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Gently add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

Source
  • https://tasty.co/recipe/original-orange-chicken-by-panda-express

docs.title: Venezuelan Beef Liver and Onions
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 6 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 2 tbsp oil
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • 1.5 lb liver strips
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 1 tbsp butter
  • 3 sliced onions
  • 0.5 cup white wine
  • 2 tbsp flour
  • 2 cup beef stock
  • 1 large cast-iron skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil. Add garlic cloves and sauté until fragrant, stirring constantly to avoid burning, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Add the liver strips, working in batches if necessary, and fry until browned on both sides. Season with salt and pepper to taste . Cook liver until reaches an internal temperature of 160 F. Remove the liver from the skillet with a slotted spoon. Set aside on a plate or bowl.

Note

To add more flavor season the liver with cumin and/or paprika. You can also add cayenne pepper if you like the heat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add oil and the butter to the same skillet. Add sliced onions and sauté until translucent and fragrant. Add the liver back to the skillet and add white wine. Let the wine reduce for 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Use the pan drippings to make a gravy. Just add flour per batch to the drippings. Cook the flour briefly for 1.5 minutes, stirring constantly, then add beef stock per batch. Cook and stir until thickened. Serve over liver and onions.

Note

Refering to batch of liver cooked

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve hot with rice, mashed potatoes or veggies.

Source
  • https://mommyshomecooking.com/venezuelan-liver-and-onions/#recipe

docs.title: Buffalo Chicken Sandwich
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 10.00 hours

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 3 chicken breast
  • 6 hamburger buns
  • 1.5 cup buttermilk
  • 1 tbsp Tapatío hot sauce
  • some cooking oil
  • 1.5 cup flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cajun seasoning
  • 6 tbsp butter
  • 6 tbsp Frank's hot sauce
  • some ranch dressing
  • 6 tsp mayonnaise
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 paper towel
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
Cut chicken breast into sizes that will fit on hamburger buns. Then slice chicken horizontally to make them thinner

Note

Slicing makes the chicken more tender than pounding

Note

Aim for 1/2 inch thickness

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Mix the buttermilk and Tapatío hot sauce in a medium bowl. Add the chicken, cover, and refrigerate at least 10 hours (overnight).

Note

Replace Tapatío with Frank's for a sweeter outcome

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
When ready to cook cooking oil to 360 F. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, mix flour, salt, and cajun seasoning together.

Note

Replace cajun seasoning with cayenne pepper or paprika for a sweeter outcome

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove the chicken from the buttermilk mixture and let excess liquid fall off. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture, then back in the buttermilk, then back in the flour.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the chicken to the heated oil and fry until cooked through and golden brown, about five minutes, flipping halfway through. Remove from the heat and set on a paper towel.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: To make the buffalo sauce, use a medium saucepan. Melt the butter and stir in Frank's hot sauce.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Meanwhile, toast the buns in the toaster until the interior of the bun is golden and crispy. Set aside.

Note

Don't forget to set toaster to bagel mode

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text:
Smear both sides of the bun with some ranch dressing . Once the chicken has fried, toss it in the buffalo sauce and place it in the sandwich.

Note

Enough ranch fully cover the bun but not enough to pour off

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Top with mayonnaise . Serve immediately.

Note

About 1tsp per sandwich, place mayo in tiny chunks since spreading is impossible due to buffalo sauce

Source
  • https://www.thespruceeats.com/buffalo-chicken-sandwich-2937545

docs.title: Buffalo Chicken Taquitos
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 0 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: Ingredients Cookware

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Source
  • https://www.instagram.com/p/CwxEjYLvkxe/

docs.title: Buttermilk Chicken Tenders
docs.text: Total Time 8.10 hours

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 2 lb chicken breast
  • 2 cup buttermilk
  • 0.5 cup pickle juice (optional)
  • 2 tbsp mustard
  • 2 tbsp hot sauce
  • some cayenne
  • some garlic powder
  • some smoked paprika
  • 2.5 cup flour
  • 3 tbsp Tony’s creole seasoning
  • 1 tbsp garlic powder
  • some cooking oil
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cut chicken breast into strips.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place buttermilk, pickle juice (optional), chicken breast strips, mustard, hot sauce, and a pinch of cayenne garlic powder, and smoked paprika into a bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix until chicken is coated. Place in fridge for 8 hours.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Whisk together flour, Tony’s creole seasoning, and garlic powder.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Shake off excess buttermilk from the chicken and press it into the flour. Gently squeeze the flour around tender and shake off excess. Let it rest on a wire rack.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Heat cooking oil to 350 F. Once at temperature, fry tenders in batches for 6 minutes. Pull chicken out when internal temp is 165 F. Drain on wire rack.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Serve with homemade creamy buffalo sauce & buttermilk ranch.

Source
  • https://www.reddit.com/r/food/comments/x4cxgt/comment/imumc72/

docs.title: Crispy Jalapeño Popper Chicken Taquitos
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 23 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 480 g cooked & shredded chicken breast
  • 60 g bacon bits
  • 1 diced jalapeno
  • 15 g sliced green onion
  • 90 g mozorella cheese
  • 120 g cream cheese
  • 15 g minced garlic
  • some ranch seasoning
  • 12 mini corn tortillas
  • some cooking oil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a bowl, mix cooked & shredded chicken breast, cooked bacon bits, diced jalapeno, sliced green onion, mozorella cheese, softened cream cheese, minced garlic, ranch seasoning

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Get mini corn tortillas, place them all on a plate, cover with a moist paper towel & into the microwave for 45 seconds

Note

This step will prevent the tortillas from breaking when rolling

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Get the steamed tortillas, distrubute the mixture to cover about 40% of the tortilla surface area and roll them up tightly

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Place on non stick tray, and spray the top of them with cooking oil and bake at 200C/400F for 23 minutes flipping them halfway through.

Note

The oil on top is what makes them crispy

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Serve with extra ranch and leftover bacon bits and green onion

Source
  • https://www.instagram.com/p/CxaQB3gPB1A/

docs.title: Guy Fieri Ringer Burger
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 1 minutes

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Ingredients Cookware
  • 5 oz ground beef (80/20 blend)
  • some salt
  • 1 tbsp nacho cheese sauce
  • 1 slice (the sharper the better) cheddar cheese
  • 0.8 tbsp garlic paste
  • 0.4 tbsp melted unsalted butter
  • 1 hamburger bun
  • some Donkey Sauce
  • 3 slices of kosher dill pickle
  • 1 crispy onion ring
  • 1 tbsp Guy Fieri Bourbon Brown Sugar BBQ Sauce
  • 0.5 oz thinly-sliced sweet onion
  • 1 thin slice beefsteak tomato
  • 1.5 oz finely-shaved iceberg lettuce
  • 1 cast iron pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a flat-top grill or cast iron pan over very high heat. Form the ground beef (80/20 blend) into a tight ball and season with salt. Place hamburger ball on grill to sear for 45 seconds, then flatten with a heavy spatula to about ⅓ inch thickness.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook for 90 seconds to develop a crust on the first side of the bottom. Flip over and cook on the second side for 1 minute to develop another crust. Add nacho cheese sauce to the top of the hamburger and top the cheese sauce with (the sharper the better) cheddar cheese.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine the garlic paste and melted unsalted butter. Brush the inside of hamburger bun halves with the mixture and toast on the grill or pan for 4 seconds, until golden and crisp. Flip and toast for 4 seconds so the outsides are also lightly toasted.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Smear Donkey Sauce on the sliced side of both bun halves.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Layer the base with slices of kosher dill pickle and the burger patty.

Note

Make the slices paper-thin

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Top burger with crispy onion ring, Guy Fieri Bourbon Brown Sugar BBQ Sauce, thinly-sliced sweet onion, thin slice beefsteak tomato and finely-shaved iceberg lettuce.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Place the top half of the bun on top.

Source
  • https://www.carnival.com/recipes/guy-fieri-ringer-burger
